raw.title: [ARFC] Deploy Aave v3 on Sonic
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
## [ARFC] Deploy Aave v3 on Sonic

## Author: ACI

## Date: 2025-01-07
-----

>Risk Parameters have been provided by Service Providers and this section has been updated 2025-01-30

## Simple Summary:

This ARFC seeks the community’s input on the deployment of Aave V3 on Sonic Mainnet.

## Background:

Sonic is a new Layer 1 EVM blockchain offering 10,000 TPS and fee monetization for app builders. It is the newest blockchain from the creators of Fantom which reached a peak TVL of circa $14.5 billion in 2021. 

## Motivation

Aave has deployed on multiple promising new L1 and L2 EVM networks and is often one of the largest protocols on these networks. Given the impressive history of the team building Sonic, and the innovations it promises, it represents a strong candidate for deployment of Aave V3. In addition, the fee monetization for apps has potential to be an additional income source for Aave.

## Proof of Liquidity (POL) and Deposit Commitments:

The Sonic Foundation will provide the following, upon its deployment is confirmed:

- 15M USD Funding from Sonic
- 800k USD stablecoins from Aave
- Up to 50M $S tokens Supply
- 20M of USDC Supply


## Specification:

Risk Parameters have been provided by Service Providers and this section has been updated 2025-01-30

| Parameter |  |  |  |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Asset | WETH | wS | USDC.e |
| Isolation Mode | No | No | No |
| Enable Borrow | Yes | Yes | Yes |
| Enable Collateral | Yes | Yes | Yes |
| Loan To Value | 80% | 35% | 75% |
| Liquidation Threshold | 83% | 40% | 78% |
| Liquidation Bonus | 6% | 10% | 5% |
| Reserve Factor | 15% | 20% | 10% |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10% | 10% | 10% |
| Supply Cap | 400 | 3,000,000 | 2,000,000 |
| Borrow Cap | 370 | 1,500,000 | 1,900,000 |
| Debt Ceiling | - | - | - |
| UOptimal | 90% | 45% | 90% |
| Base | 0% | 0% | 0% |
| Slope1 | 2.7% | 7% | 12.5% |
| Slope2 | 80% | 300% | 40% |
| Stable Borrowing | No | No | No |
| Flashloanable | Yes | Yes | Yes |
| Siloed Borrowing | No | No | No |
| Borrowable in Isolation | No | No | Yes |
| E-Mode Category | N/A | N/A | N/A |

## Disclaimer:

This proposal is powered by Skywards. The ACI is not directly affiliated with  Fantom or Sonic and did not receive any compensation for creating this proposal. 

## Useful Links

[[TEMP CHECK] Deploy Aave v3 on Sonic](https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-deploy-aave-v3-on-sonic/20259) 

[TEMP CHECK Snapshot](https://snapshot.box/#/s:aave.eth/proposal/0xdad0834b0a2b0b9b5b48688f58f1f0e5c75f7a17185975dbbeeb88f558dd65b2)

## Next Steps

1. Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage.
2. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

## Copyright:

Copyright and related rights waived under [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

cleaned.title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard EIGEN to Aave V3 Ethereum
cleaned.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193

raw.title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard EIGEN to Aave V3 Ethereum
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
## **Author: ACI**

## **Date: 2024-10-04**

---

### **Simple Summary:**

The current TEMP CHECK aims to onboard EIGEN, the native token of Eigenlayer, in Aave V3 Ethereum Market. This onboarding will allow Aave users to supply and borrow EIGEN, thereby enhancing the utility and liquidity of the Eigenlayer token within the DeFi ecosystem and more specifically, within the Aave ecosystem.

### **Motivation/Background:**

Eigenlayer is a protocol focused on shared security and restaking, enabling Ethereum stakers to extend their security guarantees to multiple services and protocols. EIGEN is the governance and utility token for Eigenlayer, playing a critical role in the network’s operations, staking mechanisms, and protocol governance. By onboarding EIGEN to Aave V3, we aim to create new opportunities for Aave users to engage with this emerging staking ecosystem, while expanding EIGEN's liquidity.

**Benefits of listing that token:** 

Provide opportunities for Aave users to borrow against their EIGEN to unlock liquidity, or alternatively to borrow EIGEN against other collateral allowing them to stake it in the Eigenlayer ecosystem to earn rewards.

**Market Impact:** 

We see no significant market impact from onboarding EIGEN except for providing new opportunities to Aave users which may cause users to switch from borrowing other tokens against their collateral. Overall we see onboarding EIGEN as net good for Aave users as it expands opportunities for them to engage in a new, important ecosystem.

**Chain to be deployed/listed:** 

Ethereum Mainnet

**Proof of Liquidity (POL) and Deposit Commitments:** 

POL and Deposit Commitments will be discussed at the ARFC stage.

### **Useful Links:**

- [Eigenlayer website](https://eigenfoundation.org/)
- [Eigenlayer documentation](https://docs.eigenfoundation.org/category/faq-eigen-token-overview)

### **Disclaimer:**

This proposal is powered by Skywards. The Aave Chan Initiative is not directly affiliated with Eigenlayer Foundation and did not receive compensation for creation this proposal.

ACI and ACI employees may be holders of EIGEN.

### **Next Steps:**

1. If consensus is reached on this TEMP CHECK, escalate this proposal to the Snapshot stage.
2. If the Snapshot outcome is YAE, escalate to ARFC stage.
3. Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage.
4. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

### **Copyright:**

Copyright and related rights waived under [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/)

raw.title: [TEMP CHECK] Deploy Aave v3 on Ink
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
# [TEMP CHECK] Deploy Aave v3 on Ink

## Author: ACI

## Date: 2025-02-07
-----

## Simple Summary:

This TEMP CHECK seeks the community’s input on the deployment of Aave V3 on Ink.

## Background:

Ink is an Ethereum OP Stack layer 2 blockchain designed to be the house of DeFi for the Superchain; a powerful baselayer for deploying innovative DeFi protocols. 

- **Sub-second block times**: 1s block times Day 1, sub-second blocks coming soon.
- **Security**: Sequencer-level security to protect users from malicious intents and exploits.
- **Interoperability**: A commitment to the seamless flow of capital across the Superchain and beyond.
- **Unleashed by Kraken**: Ink will leverage Kraken's security and crypto expertise to support builders and users alike as they move towards independent financial sovereignty.
- **Scaling Ethereum**: Ink is dedicated to scaling Ethereum with a powerful L2 that enhances performance and accessibility.

## Motivation

Aave has deployed on multiple promising new L1 and L2 EVM networks and is often one of the largest protocols on these networks. 

Ink is a Layer 2 built on the [OP Stack](https://docs.optimism.io/stack/getting-started) and part of the Superchain. Aligning with the Optimism Superchain promotes interoperability and the seamless flow of funds from one chain to the next, allowing Ink to push the limits of DeFi and Aave Protocol.

### Ink features:

- **Abstraction**: Ink integrates Kraken's infrastructure and enables users to enjoy a unified experience from converting fiat to the cutting edge of DeFi.
- **DeFi-first**: Ink aims to scale up DeFi's user base and evolve the quality and range of DeFi products.
- **UX**: Ink pursues a user experience that makes your onchain journey a breeze by leveraging aggregation, automation and abstraction. Check out our [Ink Kit](https://docs.inkonchain.com/build/ink-kit) here for more.
- **Speed**: 1s block times on day one with subsecond block times coming soon.
- **Security**: Kraken's decade-long record of security and reliability will be reflected and pushed forward on Ink.
- **Support**: Builders can expect rich documentation, expert guidance, workshops, tailored onboarding, dedicated community channels and financial support to bring their ideas to life.
- **Low Fees**: Harnessing the scalability of Optimism and the security of Ethereum, gas fees on Ink are a fraction of mainnet.
- **Open Source, Scaling Ethereum**: At Ink, we build in the open, benefiting all.
- **EVM compatible**: Seamlessly deploy any Solidity contract written for Ethereum Mainnet or other L2s directly on Ink without modifications.

## Proof of Liquidity (POL) and Deposit Commitments:

More details will be shared on ARFC stage.

## Specification:

Risk Parameters will be provided by Service Providers and this section will be updated at ARFC stage if proposal moves forward, after successful TEMP CHECK Snapshot.

Useful Links

https://inkonchain.com/

https://docs.inkonchain.com/general/about

## Disclaimer:

This proposal is powered by Skywards. The ACI is not directly affiliated with Ink or Kraken and did not receive any compensation for creating this proposal.

## Next Steps

1. If consensus is reached on this [TEMP CHECK], escalate this proposal to the Snapshot stage.
2. If the Snapshot outcome is YAE, this proposal will be escalated to ARFC stage.
3. Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage.
4. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

## Copyright:

Copyright and related rights waived under [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/)

raw.title: [ARFC] Onboard SCR to Aave V3 Scroll Instance
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
## Author: ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)

## Date: 2024-11-05

---
> Risk Parameters have been updated accordingly with Risk Service Providers feedback 2024-11-26


### **Simple Summary:**

The current ARFC aims to onboard SCR, the native token of Scroll, on the Aave V3 Scroll Instance. This onboarding will allow Aave users to supply and borrow SCR, thereby enhancing the utility and liquidity of the Scroll token within the DeFi ecosystem and more specifically, within the Aave ecosystem.

### **Motivation/Background:**

Scroll is an Ethereum Layer 2 chain which already has an Aave instance deployment and SCR is the governance token for the Scroll L2. By onboarding SCR to Aave V3, we aim to create new opportunities for Aave users to engage with this emerging staking ecosystem, while expanding SCR’s liquidity.

**Benefits of listing this token:**

Provide opportunities for Aave users to borrow against their SCR to unlock liquidity, or alternatively to borrow SCR against other collateral allowing them to participate in Scroll governance.

**Market Impact:**

We see no significant market impact from onboarding SCR except for providing new opportunities to Aave users which may cause users to switch from borrowing other tokens against their collateral. Overall we see onboarding SCR as net good for Aave users as it expands opportunities for them to engage in a new L2 ecosystem.

**Chain to be deployed/listed:**

Scroll.

**Proof of Liquidity (POL) and Deposit Commitments:**

POL and Deposit Commitments will be discussed at the ARFC stage. 

As disclosed by Marc Zeller, founder of ACI, the ACI Multisig has received 510K SCR on behalf of Aave DAO. Those funds will be coordinated with Karpatkey and Tokenlogic to define best usage of this airdrop. 

### **Specification**

Risk Parameters have been provided by Risk Service Providers on 2024-11-25

| Parameter | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Network | Scroll |
| Isolation Mode | N/A |
| Borrowable | Yes |
| Collateral Enabled | No |
| Supply Cap | 360,000 |
| Borrow Cap | 180,000 |
| Debt Ceiling | - |
| LTV | - |
| LT | - |
| Liquidation Bonus | - |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | - |
| Variable Base | 0.0% |
| Variable Slope1 | 7.00% |
| Variable Slope2 | 300.0% |
| Uoptimal | 45.00% |
| Reserve Factor | 20.00% |
| Stable Borrowing | Disabled |
| Flashloanable | Yes |
| Siloed Borrowing | No |
| Borrowable in Isolation | No |
| E-Mode Category | N/A |

### **Useful Links:**

- [Scroll website](https://scroll.io/)
- [Scroll docs](https://docs.scroll.io/en/home/)
- [[TEMP CHECK]Onboard SCR to Aave V3 Scroll Instance](https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-onboard-scr-to-aave-v3-scroll-instance/19568)
- [[TEMP CHECK Snapshot] Onboard SCR to Aave V3 Scroll Instance](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0x900027a0dc30946b463ce8e57a8901b5fc1158546b4d00acae4d2d823d8de732)

### **Disclaimer:**

This proposal is powered by Skywards. ACI is not directly affiliated with Scroll and did not receive compensation for creation of this proposal.

ACI and ACI employees may be holders of SCR.

### **Next Steps:**

1. Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage.
2. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

### **Copyright:**

Copyright and related rights waived under [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/)

raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
---

Title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard wbETH on Aave V3 BNB Chain 
Author: ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)
Date: 2024-03-05

---

## **Summary**

This TEMP CHECK proposes the addition of wbETH the Binance Liquid Staked ETH Token to Aave V3 BNB Chain to enhance LST liquidity and asset diversity.

## **Motivation**

Liquid Staked Tokens are one of the premier collateral types on Aave and drive most of the ETH borrow demand. wBETH is one of the largest Liquid Staking Tokens on the market and one of the more productive assets available on BNB Chain.  

The Aave-Chan Initiative supports LST diversity in Aave V3 and looks to add more LST to the new BNB Chain deployment.

## **Specification**

Contract: [0xa2E3356610840701BDf5611a53974510Ae27E2e1](https://bscscan.com/token/0xa2E3356610840701BDf5611a53974510Ae27E2e1)

Detailed risk parameters will be formulated and shared in the ARFC phase, after positive community feedback from this TEMP CHECK.

**Useful links:** 
- Website: https://www.binance.com/en/ethereum-staking

## Disclaimer

The ACI is not presenting this TEMP CHECK on behalf of any third party and is not compensated for creating this ARFC.

## Next Steps

1. If consensus is reached on this [TEMP CHECK], escalate this proposal to the Snapshot stage.
2. If the Snapshot outcome is YAE, this proposal will be escalated to ARFC stage
3. Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage
4. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal

## Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

decision.summary: The proposal to deploy Aave v3 on Tron aims to expand Aave's presence to the second largest EVM blockchain, accessing a substantial stablecoin liquidity pool and user base. Historical similar proposals to onboard assets or upgrade savings modules showed strong community support and positive TVL impact, reinforcing the strategic growth opportunity. Forum sentiment is mixed but leans cautiously supportive, emphasizing potential revenue gains while noting technical considerations with Tron's EVM compatibility. Timeline metrics show unanimous early and sustained support for YAE, and market impacts indicate modest positive TVL and price responses. Overall, the analysis supports a change stance recommending deployment.
key_arguments_for: Tron holds approximately $73bn bridged TVL with $69bn in stablecoins, representing significant liquidity and market opportunity.
The Tron DAO has committed liquidity to bootstrap the deployment, reducing initial risk.
Similar past proposals onboarding new assets or upgrades consistently passed with strong support and positive TVL impact.
Early and sustained voting timeline metrics show unanimous and stable support for YAE option.
Forum comments highlight the large user base, especially in Asia and parts of Africa, and the revenue opportunity for Aave.
key_arguments_against: Tron is not fully EVM-compatible, which may cause technical challenges requiring assessment before ARFC stage.
Several forum comments express initial skepticism or caution about Tron’s ecosystem and technical nuances.
The sentiment analysis shows more negative than positive comments, indicating some community reservations.
Uncertainty remains around finalized risk parameters and deployment details, to be clarified at ARFC stage.

evidence.quote: Forum sentiment summary: 9 comments total, 1 positive, 5 negative, 3 neutral. Early comments skeptical but some shifted to supportive. Key points include large user base and stablecoin volume on Tron, and technical concerns over EVM compatibility.
Lead ratio by quartile is 1.0 for YAE option, indicating unanimous early and sustained support with high stability and early voting dominance.

Similar proposals included onboarding tETH to Aave v3 Prime, GHO Savings Upgrade, and adding stS to Aave v3 Sonic. All passed with YAE winning and showed positive or neutral TVL impact, reinforcing confidence in strategic upgrades.

decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'YAE' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- The proposal is supported by unanimous and stable voting timeline metrics favoring YAE, indicating strong early consensus.
- Historical similar proposals have passed successfully with positive TVL impacts, suggesting that deploying Aave v3 on Tron aligns with past successful strategic expansions.
- Forum sentiment is mixed but generally cautious supportive; the recommendation to change mirrors this cautiously optimistic community view, balancing technical concerns with opportunity.
- Market impacts show positive TVL and price changes, reinforcing the proposal's potential to benefit the ecosystem sustainably.
